metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8832 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The fix for the Linux kernel in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS for CVE-2019-14615 ("TheLinux kernel did not properly clear data structures on context switches forcertain Intel graphics processors.") was discovered to be incomplete,meaning that in versions of the kernel before 4.15.0-91.92, an attackercould use this vulnerability to expose sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8832` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1076-oem - 4.15.0-1076.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1056.57
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1063.67
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-gke - 4.15.0-1055.58
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-oracle - 4.15.0-1035.39
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92').
linux-oem package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1076.86').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.57').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-gke-4.15 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.58').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.39').
